intro: Psychotria costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually elliptical, glossy, and have a dark green color with a slightly waxy texture. The flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and often have a striking purple or red color, attracting various pollinators.
